qas.question: What equipment was acquired to aid in Afghanistan?

answers.text: main battle tanks, artillery, unmanned air vehicles

qas.question: What large transport plane is part of the CAF mission?
What new type of helicopter was recently acquired?
When was the renewal and re-equipment effort started?

plausible_answers.text: main battle tanks, artillery, unmanned air vehicles and other systems

qas.question: What equipment was acquired to aid in Iraq?
What small transport plane is part of the CAF mission?
What new type of helicopter was not recently acquired?
When was the renewal and re-equipment effort ended?

context: The <a3_0><b7_0>2006<b7_0/><a3_0/> renewal and re-equipment effort has resulted in the acquisition of specific equipment (<a0_0><b4_0>main battle tanks, artillery, unmanned air vehicles<a0_0/> and other systems<b4_0/>) to support the mission in Afghanistan. It has also encompassed initiatives to renew certain so-called "core capabilities" (such as the air force's medium range transport aircraft fleet – the <a1_0><b5_0>C-130 Hercules<b5_0/><a1_0/> – and the army's truck and armoured vehicle fleets). In addition, new systems (such as C-17 Globemaster III strategic transport aircraft and <a2_0><b6_0>CH-47 Chinook<b6_0/> heavy-lift helicopters<a2_0/>) have also been acquired for the Armed Forces.
